definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: She complained to me about his impoliteness.
He tried to atone for his rudeness by sending her flowers.
sentences.chinese: 他想送些鲜花给她来弥补自己的粗鲁无礼。

sentences.english: She's tolerant toward those impudent colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 她对那些无礼的同事采取宽容的态度。

sentences.english: It's irreverent for a man not to take his hat off in church.
sentences.chinese: 一个人在教堂里不脱帽子是无礼的。

sentences.english: Yes, sure they should be but not at the cost of disrespecting their elders.
sentences.chinese: 但是对他们的呵护不能以对长辈的无礼为代价。

sentences.english: It saddened her to watch him speak rudely like that.
sentences.chinese: 看到他那样粗暴无礼地说话，她感到十分痛心。

sentences.english: It jumped up and down disrespectfully, mocking the hunting soldiers. It threw a nut at them.
sentences.chinese: 它无礼地上窜下跳，戏弄士兵们，还朝他们扔果核。

sentences.english: For a black man to be so brash was unique at the time.
sentences.chinese: 一个黑人如此轻率无礼在当时是很少见的。

sentences.english: I put my request in an absurd, almost insolent form.
sentences.chinese: 我把我的请求用荒谬的甚至无礼的形式说出来了。

sentences.english: To my way thinking. I think you behaved rudely before your dad.
sentences.chinese: 依我看来，你在你父亲面前的表现太无礼了。

sentences.english: I was offended by his discourteous reply.
sentences.chinese: 他无礼的回答使我很生气。

sentences.english: Excuse my interrupting you so rudely.
sentences.chinese: 请原谅我这样无礼地打断你。

sentences.english: Later, Vivian began to feel sorry that she had been rude to her mom.
sentences.chinese: 一会儿，薇薇安也开始对刚才的无礼感到抱歉。

sentences.english: The saucy child protruded her tongue .
sentences.chinese: 这无礼的孩子伸出了她的舌头。

sentences.english: I could say you're a kind person or you're a rude person.
sentences.chinese: 我会说你是好人，或者你是无礼的人。

sentences.english: His behaviour shows his lack of consideration for others.
sentences.chinese: 他在舞会上的行为粗鲁无礼。

definition: unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
fail to appreciate sb's kindness/not know how to appreciate favors
not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
variant of 魯莽|鲁莽[lu3 mang3]
to disrespect one's superiors/to offend one's elders
to have the impertinence/to have the cheek to
